thread.title: John Derian Moves Into the West Village

author: Rima Suqi
title: John Derian Moves Into the West Village
text:
IT’S BEEN 23 years since John Derian, 55, opened his first New York City shop, filling it with his quirky-cool decou-page pieces and antiques. Since then, he’s added two neighboring stores—one for furniture, the other for bedding—turning a once-sleepy East Village stretch into a destination for bohemian-chic shopping.
Now, with the March opening of a 500-square-foot West Vill-age shop, he may do the same for a quaint block on Christopher Street. “I’ve had a crush on that little row of white-painted houses since the ’90s,”... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
